title: A Balatro-Like Slots Machine Game Surprise-Launched On Xbox Game Pass
description: For the first time, CloverPit is available on console after surprise-releasing yesterday on Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, and Xbox Game Pass (Ultimate and Premium tiers). The slot machine roguelike takes inspiration from Balatro and Buckshot Roulette, even featuring Jimbo from the former in the new Xbox launch trailer seen below. Players are tasked with paying off their gambling debt from inside a disgusting cell, and if they can't, they take a terrible tumble. CloverPit originally came out on Steam on September 26. It was one of the games that actually delayed its release to avoid Hollow Knight: Silksong on September 4. CloverPit planned to launch September 3 initially. That change of course seems to have played out favorably for the roguelike, as publisher Future Friends Games and developer Panik Arcade have stated CloverPit has sold over 1 million copies on Steam so far. Panik Arcade teased new DLC for CloverPit in the Xbox launch trailer as well. On X, the developer notes that the add-on will be named Unholy Fusion and will release on PC and Xbox. However, it's unknown at this time if it will be free or paid DLC. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Xbox Finally Fixes An Annoying Part About Console-Specific Livestreams
description: The Xbox Partner Preview showed off a bunch of cool and interesting projects coming to Xbox consoles and PC in the future, including Armatus, The Mound: Omen of Cthulhu, and Raji: Kaliyuga. However, the event itself bucked an annoying trend that other trailer showcases continue to follow, as each trailer that aired during the event showed the logos for every console the game will launch on, not just Xbox. Traditionally, when a game makes an appearance during one of these events, the final shot confirms the game for the host company's consoles--PlayStation consoles for Sony, the Switch or Switch 2 for Nintendo, and so on. However, in yesterday's event the PS5 and Nintendo Switch 2 logos appeared multiple times throughout the showcase. The final shot from the Armatus trailer that aired during the Xbox Partner Preview.Of the 16 titles shown during the Xbox Partner Preview, 13 of them included either a PlayStation or Nintendo Switch logo in their ending graphic. The three exceptions were Echo Generation 2, Roadside Research, and Cloverpit, but all three of them are, as of this writing, only coming to Xbox consoles. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Next Blox Fruits Update: Everything You Need To Know
description: If you're looking for information on the next Blox Fruits update, you have come to the right place. One of Roblox’s most popular and most entertaining games, Blox Fruits is a seafaring adventure that pulls inspiration from the iconic anime franchise One Piece. Since launching in 2019, this swashbuckling experience has remained at the top of the charts and received a steady stream of updates to refine and improve the title. With such a large and fervent playerbase, there’s little surprise that the demand for updates is huge. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Roblox Blox Fruits Stock And Restock Times
description: If you are an ardent Blox Fruits player, the ocean-faring Roblox experience that has taken the world by storm, then you will want to keep a keen eye on the many stock options scattered around the Blox Fruits seas. Those titular fruits are the keys to success, but not only are some rarer than others, but vendors constantly change their wares, so we’re here to explain everything you need to know about the Blox Fruits stock as well as restock times. Table of Contents [hide]What is the Blox Fruits Stock System? What is the Blox Fruits Stock System? The most important part of Blox Fruit is, unsurprisingly, those titular Blox Fruits. If you want to expand your collection, you will need to amass some money through regular gameplay and then head to a vendor to buy Blox Fruit. Sadly, not all of the Blox Fruit are available at once, and their appearance is dictated by their rarity. So, you’re much more likely to see common Blox Fruit than you are rare ones. Anyone wanting to expand their abilities or collect all of the Blox Fruit will need to routinely visit the in-game vendors with the hopes of eventually finding and purchasing every Blox Fruit in the game. Regular vendors have at least three Blox Fruit, while the Advanced Fruit Dealer on Mirage Island holds five. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Ghost Of Yotei PS5 Slim Bundles And Collector's Edition Get Huge Discounts
description: PS5 Slim: Ghost of Yotei Black Limited Edition Bundle $500 (was $600) | PS Direct Exclusive See at PS Direct PS5 Slim: Ghost of Yotei Gold Limited Edition Bundle $499 (was $600) See at Amazon See at PS Direct See at Walmart See at Target See at Best Buy See at GameStop Ghost of Yotei just launched last month, so most PS5 owners probably weren't expecting a Black Friday discount on the beautiful new open-world adventure from Sucker Punch Productions. Indeed, the standard edition is not on sale during PlayStation's holiday promotion, but Ghost of Yotei's Collector's Edition and limited-edition PS5 hardware have received surprise price cuts at PlayStation Direct and major retailers. Most notably, the PS5 Slim Ghost of Yotei Limited Edition Bundles are $100 off, which lowers the price to only $500. PlayStation Direct has an exclusive PS5 Slim with black ink illustrations on the console cover and DualSense. Alternatively, you can get the Ghost of Yotei Gold Limited Edition Bundle at PS Direct as well as Amazon, Walmart, and other major retailers. Both bundles come with a digital copy of Ghost of Yotei ($70 value), which makes these the best Black Friday PS5 console deals in terms of value. Ghost of Yotei Limited Edition PS5 Slim and DualSense Controller Ghost of Yotei Limited Edition Black DualSense Controller $65 (was $85) | PS Direct Exclusive See at PS Direct Ghost of Yotei Limited Edition Gold DualSense Controller $64 (was $85) See at Amazon See at Walmart See at Target See at Best Buy See at PS Direct See at GameStop Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The Xbox 360 Vs PS3 Console War Was A Race To 10 Million Sales, Ex-Xbox Exec Says
description: The era of console wars seems to be nearing its end, but one of its key players, Peter Moore, who led the charge during the launch of the Xbox 360, is sharing his memories of his time on the gaming frontlines. When it came to pitting the Xbox 360 against the PlayStation 3, Moore says 10 million was the magic number--"You've got this flywheel effect ... of [if] your mate in the school yard's got one, you better get one." Speaking to Eurogamer, Moore explained that getting the Xbox 360 into the market ahead of the PS3 was key to its strong performance, saying that the first 10 million sales were vital. "I think it was really important to get it out first," Moore said. "Get going, get momentum, and aim for that 10 million installed base that I felt that would give us an amazing advantage over whatever Sony could do to catch up." He explained that having the 10 million install base creates a network effect where a sense of social pressure could drive sales--"All of a sudden you're out of place and you're on the outside if you're not coming to school, or going to class in college the next day, or even coming to work, and saying what a night we had playing Halo, or whatever game it happened to be." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Ubisoft Posts Strong First-Half Growth And Teases Major Creative Shake-Up Coming In 2026
description: After a short delay, Ubisoft has posted its first-half earnings figures for 2025-2026. The company says that its Q2 net bookings exceeded expectations and its deal with Tencent to invest $1.2 billion in Vantage Studios--a new subsidiary focused on its three main franchises--is expected to close within a few days. Ubisoft says that its Q2 net bookings were up 39% year-on-year, driven by stronger-than-expected performance across its games catalogue and TV projects. The company had initially predicted that it would reach $520 million for its quarterly books, but this figure increased to $566.7 million. "Our portfolio showed contrasting dynamics this quarter, with softer trends for Rainbow Six Siege, reflecting a phase of evolution for the game in an intense FPS environment, offset by strong performances across the rest of the catalog. The Assassin’s Creed franchise exceeded our expectations, confirming its positive momentum and ability to engage players over time. The Division 2 also continued to perform strongly, benefiting from the momentum of the Battle for Brooklyn DLC," Ubisoft Yves Guillemot said in a press release. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Death Stranding 2 Collector's Edition & DualSense Get Limited-Time Holiday Discounts
description: Death Stranding 2: On the Beach Collector's Edition $130 (was $230) See at PS Direct Death Stranding 2: On the Beach Standard Edition $50 (was $70) See at Amazon See at PS Direct See at Walmart Death Stranding 2: On the Beach DualSense Controller $65 (was $85) See at PS Direct Several of the biggest PS5 games are on sale for Black Friday, with Death Stranding 2: On the Beach being one of the big highlights. Fans can save $100 on the Death Stranding 2 Collector’s Edition, which is down to $130 (was $100) has also gotten a big price cut and is on sale for $130, down from $230. This bundle gets you the full game, a selection of bonus digital content, and several physical collectibles including figures of Magellan Man and Dollman, a letter from game director Hideo Kojima, and more. If that's too expensive, you can also grab the physical Death Stranding 2 standard edition for just $50 (was $70). In addition to these game deals, the Death Stranding 2 Special Edition DualSense PS5 controller is also discounted to $65 (was $85). Death Stranding 2: On the Beach Collector's Edition $130 (was $230) The Collector’s Edition for Death Stranding 2: On the Beach features a selection of digital and physical items. It comes with a digital download code for Death Stranding 2, a 15-inch statue of Magellan Man inside the collector’s box, a three-inch Dollman figurine on a keychain loop, art cards, and a letter with a message from Hideo Kojima. The digital extras include early in-game unlocks for weapons, equipment, and cosmetics. See at PS Direct Death Stranding 2: On the Beach Standard Edition $50 (was $70) The standard edition of Death Stranding 2 doesn't include any extras, but you at least get the full game on the physical disc. This Black Friday discount drops the game to $50 (was $70) at Amazon, PlayStation Direct, and Walmart. See at Amazon See at PS Direct See at Walmart Death Stranding 2: On the Beach DualSense Controller $65 (was $85) The Death Stranding 2 DualSense controller is also on sale, and this was designed in partnership with Kojima Productions. It has a sleek black finish and insignia based on the fictional Drawbridge company that appears in the sequel, orange accents, and the “Death Stranding 2” logo on the back. On the controller touchpad you’ll find the motto of Drawbridge: "Both stick and rope, to protect and connect. Together, from tomorrow." See at PS Direct A direct sequel to 2019’s Death Stranding, Death Stranding 2: On the Beach continues the story of Sam Porter Bridges as he works to reunite the scattered cities of Earth following a cataclysmic event that left humanity on the edge of extinction. Directed by Hideo Kojima, the game also features a cinematic presentation, with several characters modeled on and voiced by Hollywood celebrities, including Norman Reedus, Guillermo del Toro, and Elle Fanning. If you're looking to fill out your PS5 collections, you'll want to check out the many other PlayStation Black Friday deals available now. You can grab big discounts on standard editions of PS5 exclusives like Astro Bot, God of War Ragnarok, and Gran Turismo 7, or pick up Collector's Editions of Marvel's Spider-Man 2, Horizon Forbidden West, and Ghost of Yotei, all of which are at least $100 off. You'll also find deals on limited edition DualSense controllers based on many of these games, including Astro Bot, God of War Ragnarok, and Ghost of Yotei. We've collected some of our favorite PlayStation Black Friday deals in the list below. Once you've checked those out, give GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub a look to see even more holiday discounts on everything from video games and Blu-rays to Legos, figures, and beyond. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Bring Democracy To The Alien Hordes With This Helldivers 2 PS5 Black Friday Deal
description: Helldivers 2 $30 (was $40) See at Amazon See at PS Direct See at Walmart One of the biggest recent hits on PS5 has been Helldivers 2, a game best described as an online, PvE multiplayer third-person shooter with a satircal tone that melds Starship Troopers with Warhammer 40,000. If you haven't yet enlisted in Super Earth's war machine, you can finally join the fight with this Black Friday deal on the game, as it's down to $30 (was $40) for the sales event. This is a great excuse to check out the multiplayer shooter if you've been interested--and might be a good opportunity to convince a few friends to pick up the game and group up, too. This limited-time deal is available at Amazon, PlayStation Direct, and Walmart. Helldivers 2 $30 (was $40) Helldivers 2 has a simple but engaging premise. As one of Super Earth's defenders, it's up to you to bring the concept of Managed Democracy to worlds infested with vile alien species and marauding machines. How do you spread the good word? With guns, bombing runs, and well-placed tactical nuclear strikes deep in the heart of enemy territory. An always-online game, Helldivers 2 can be played solo or with fellow soldiers, and it receives constant updates that add new weapons to your arsenal and shiny cosmetics to collect. See at Amazon See at PS Direct See at Walmart Helldivers 2 sets itself apart in the live-service game genre by adopting a novel spin on in-game currencies. While you'll regularly earn rewards from successful missions and for taking part in community events, the premium in-game currency can also be earned simply by playing the game. While it does take longer than simply swiping your credit card and buying the resources, you can get everything that Helldivers 2 has to offer if you don't mind grinding away for it. Luckily, the game's battle passes don't expire, and you can unlock what you want from it when you want it, provided that you have enough points saved up. While it's multiplayer-only, the game's playerbase is large and active, and it's still easy to find others to play with, even over a year later. Even better, developer Arrowhead doesn't plan to stop supporting the title anytime soon, as it envisions it as a forever game like the legendary Runescape, so it appears Helldivers 2 will be around for quite a while. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Gran Turismo 7 Gets Big Black Friday Discount
description: Gran Turismo 7 $30 (was $70) See at Amazon See at PS Direct See at Walmart Gran Turismo has been PlayStation's premiere racing game franchise for decades, and if you haven't experienced it yet, you can get a Black Friday deal on Gran Turismo 7. Normally $70, you can get behind the wheel of the game for just $30 and burn some digital rubber in photorealistic races. Gran Turismo 7 $30 (was $70) One of the groundbreaking racing game franchises that emerged in the '90s, Gran Turismo focused on making the experience as realistic--and as good-looking--as possible. Gran Turismo 7 builds on that rich legacy, presenting a selection of finely tuned vehicles, circuits spread across the globe, and a layer of realism that will make you feel like you really are driving a vehicle that costs an obscene amount of cash in the real world. See at Amazon See at PS Direct See at Walmart While the standard edition of the Gran Turismo 7 only includes the base game, now is a good time to pick it up, as a major update called Spec III will be added to the game in December. This will add two new tracks, eight new cars, a new circuit experience, and new features like the data logger to the game. If you want to go all in on the immersion, you can pick up a PlayStation VR2 headset to create a dynamic gameplay experience. The VR headset and controllers are on sale for $300 (was $500) and it also includes the Horizon spin-off bundle Call of the Mountain. PlayStation VR2Be sure to check out the many other discounts available in PlayStation's Black Friday sale. Physical edition games like find Astro Bot, Demon's Souls, and God of War Ragnarok are all on sale, as are several collector's edition games like Ghost of Yotei, limited-edition DualSense controllers, and even PS5 console bundles. Browse some the highlights below, then visit GameSpot’s Black Friday Deals Hub for even more savings on games, Blu‑rays, graphic novels, and more. Continue Reading at GameSpot
